question.title: Azure Java SDK Storage blob gateway
question.body:
I'm working on a springboot microservice as a gateway through azure storage. This application must just be used to download and upload file on azure storage.

Everything working fine, but i'm would like to optimize that. At the moment at evering is in the memory...

To the dowload way, I get a MultipartFile file, get the inputstream and push it blobClient.upload(BinaryData.fromStream(is)) To the upload way, i get the BinaryData blob.downloadContent()

It's possible to got a low footprint memory while upload or download file ?

thanks
